metadata.title: USN-6907-1 -- Squid vulnerability
metadata.description: Joshua Rogers discovered that Squid did not properly handle multi-byte      characters during Edge Side Includes (ESI) processing. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a memory corruption error, leading  to a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6907-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  squid - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.16+esm4 squid-cgi - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.16+esm4 squid-common - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.16+esm4 squid-purge - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.16+esm4 squid3 - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.16+esm4 squidclient - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.16+esm4 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
